newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch.

text.p: * The jury in an Indiana state court trial of a tobacco damages suit was to resume deliberations on Friday. The family of a man who died of lung cancer has sued units of Philip Morris Cos Inc, RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp, Brooke Group Ltd and B.A.T Industries Plc, contending the industry was at fault for selling an addictive product that caused cancer.
Philip Morris fell 7/8 to 86-3/4 on Thursday, RJR lost 1/8 to 25-1/8, Brooke was unchanged at 5-3/8 and B.A.T ADRs gave up 3/8 to 13-3/8.

* Books-a-Million reported second-quarter earnings of $0.03 versus a year-earlier loss of $0.02, after a charge of $0.11 from store closings. According to Zacks, analysts' consensus estimate was $0.04 a share.
